intro: Chloris procumbens, commonly known as匍匐雀稗, is a low-growing perennial grass native to Australia. It features slender, spreading stems that often lie close to the ground, forming dense mats. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils. It is often used in erosion control due to its hardy nature and ability to colonize disturbed areas.
